dish_description: The dish is a budget-friendly lentil-based casserole with chicken and corn, seasoned with Italian herbs and garnished with scallions or parsley. It is designed to serve six people.

cooking_steps.description: Gather all the canned ingredients: lentils, corn, and chicken flesh.
In a pot, combine 2 and 1/2 cups of water, 1 and 1/2 cups (half a pound) of lentils, and a good cup of onions.
Add a few cloves of garlic to the pot.
Season the mixture with a pinch or a teaspoon of Italian seasoning or herbs de Provence, and some salt to taste.
Incorporate a tablespoon of chicken base to the pot for added flavor.
Bring the pot to a boil and let it cook for about 40-45 minutes, depending on the dryness of the lentils.
Add the juice from the cans of corn and chicken to the pot, stir, and continue to cook.
Once the lentils are tender, add the canned corn and chicken to the pot, bring to a boil, and heat through. Garnish with scallions or parsley before serving.
